metadata.Title: CVE-2015-8374 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
fs/btrfs/inode.c in the Linux kernel before 4.3.3 mishandles compressed inline extents, which allows local users to obtain sensitive pre-truncation information from a file via a clone action. It was discovered that the Btrfs implementation in the Linux kernel incorrectly handled compressed inline extants on truncation. A local attacker could use this to expose sensitive information.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-8374` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.13.0-77-generic - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-3.13.0-77-generic-lpae - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-3.13.0-77-lowlatency - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-3.13.0-77-powerpc-e500 - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-3.13.0-77-powerpc-e500mc - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-3.13.0-77-powerpc-smp - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-3.13.0-77-powerpc64-emb - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-3.13.0-77-powerpc64-smp - 3.13.0-77.121
linux-image-extra-3.13.0-77-generic - 3.13.0-77.121
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1002-aws - 4.4.0-1002.2
No subscription required

linux-image-3.16.0-60-generic - 3.16.0-60.80~14.04.1

notes.Note: jdstrand> android kernels (flo, goldfish, grouper, maguro, mako and manta) are not supported on the Ubuntu Touch 14.10 and earlier preview kernels linux-lts-saucy no longer receives official support linux-lts-quantal no longer receives official support tyhicks> From the fix's commit message, "This problem exists since the clone ioctl was added ...". BTRFS_IOC_CLONE was added by f2eb0a24.

criterions.comment: linux package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.13.0-77.121').
linux-aws package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1002.2').
linux-flo: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-goldfish: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
linux-grouper: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
